comment.body: Why use external sources for update downloads? Couldn't you distribute them within ZN itself?

> [sick](#comment_1_18XDV3MuaGGQFAdeBNgcDUkviz2p28RsKB): No good, the flat design :/

you mean it won't scale?

> [nofish](#comment_89_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): https more reliable, since zeronet protocol is still experimental

So it is exclusively those external sources that you update from, or are they used as a fallback in case ZN-internal update did not succeed?

> [nofish](#comment_90_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): its using this sources to update: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/master/update.pyif there is a flaw in the protocol it would be bad idea to update using the same protocol

why?
if there is a flaw in the protocoll, it could use the github and others as fallback.

> [nofish](#comment_91_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Flaw can be security problem, then anyone able to modify the site containing the source code.

i see, but signed updates should not be too hard to implement

> [sick](#comment_3_18XDV3MuaGGQFAdeBNgcDUkviz2p28RsKB): No, I do not like it

why? what reason? and what would you suggest ?

unless i want to hide the fact that I'm using ZN at all.
Are updates fetched from gh through tor if ZN is configured to use tor?
You say it is similar to BitMessage, I'd be interested in how it is different from bitmessage. Or could they even be made compatible? Does your solution scale?

Is there a way to recover lost mails?
It still says 11K/48K but my sent folder is empty and my inbox only shows two mails from echobot. I restarted ZN and it's still like that.

I tried in another browser, same result. 
As contacts also only echobot is shown. 
But aren't all mails stored on each peer? 
So could I not somehow reset my mail boxes and it should re-download them?

yes, that worked. Thank you. All mails are back. :)
Do you also have a mail address?
